Key Match Events: Isaac Paredes hit a two-run single in the first inning, which held up as the difference in a 2-1 victory for the Cubs.
Jameson Taillon held the Yankees to one run over six innings.
Nate Pearson and Porter Hodge provided stellar relief to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager Craig Counsell expressed optimism about Paredes' performance, stating that helping the team win can boost his confidence.
Jameson Taillon reflected on the challenges Paredes faced adjusting to a new team and environment mid-season.
Isaac Paredes mentioned that his struggles were due to timing issues and a lack of consistent quality contact.
